note.title: Deriving the Formula for the Area of a Circle
note.para: Some of the geometric formulas we take for granted today were first derived by methods that anticipate some of the methods of calculus.
We can estimate the area of a circle by computing the area of an inscribed regular polygon. To see this, carry out the following steps:

list.item: Express the height h and the base b of the isosceles triangle in in terms of equation.
Using the expressions that you obtained in step 1, express the area of the isosceles triangle in terms of and r.
If an n-sided regular polygon is inscribed in a circle of radius r, find a relationship between and n.
Find an expression for the area of the n-sided polygon in terms of r and t.
To find a formula for the area of the circle, find the limit of the expression in step 4 as t goes to zero.

note.para: The technique of estimating areas of regions by using polygons is revisited in Introduction to Integration.
